title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 561.2 - Traffic control
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 561.2 - Traffic control

State Regulations
(a) Pursuant to authority conferred by the New York State Education Law, the
following traffic regulations are established on the grounds of the State

University of New York at Albany, in the City of Albany and in the Town of

Guilderland, Albany County. (1)
15 MPH is the
maximum speed limit at which vehicles may proceed on or along all roadways, except on the following roadway: (i) University Drive East and West, formerly known as Perimeter Road. (2)
25 MPH is the maximum speed
limit at which vehicles may proceed on or along the following roadway: (i) University Drive East and West, formerly
known as Perimeter Road. (b) Parking is prohibited on or along both
sides of all roadways, except as noted by parking control signs. (c) University Drive East and West, formerly
known as Perimeter Road, shall not be used as a thruway thoroughfare for motor
vehicles travelling between Washington Avenue, Fuller Road or Western Avenue
unless the driver or occupants of the vehicle have campus-related
business. (d) All persons shall
observe and obey any slow, stop, yield, and caution signs or any other posted
signs regulating traffic and parking. (e) The directions and requests of university
police officers shall be followed at all times. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
561.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
